text: The 2015 Puskás Cup was the eighth edition of the Puskás Cup and took place between 3 April to 6 April in Felcsút, Hungary. La Fábrica were the defending champions. One new team, Feyenoord Academy, were invited by the organisers for this event. On 26 March 2015, the draw took place in Felcsút, Hungary. At the drawing, former Feyenoord and Bayern Munich star Roy Makaay was also present. Former Feyenoord star, Roy Makaay drew the teams for the 2015 Puskás Cup in Felcsút, Hungary The 2015 Puskás Cup was won by Budapest Honvéd by beating three-time champions La Fábrica in the final on 6 April 2015 at the Pancho Arena in Felcsút. Hagi Academy finished third by beating Feyenoord Academy. The home side, Puskás Akadémia finished fifth by beating Panathinaikos 2-1. ==Participating teams== * Budapest Honvéd (former club of Ferenc Puskás) * La Fábrica (former club of Ferenc Puskás) * Feyenoord Academy (invited) * Hagi Academy (invited) * Panathinaikos (former club of Ferenc Puskás) * Puskás Akadémia (host) ==Venues== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Felcsút |-
